html.p: Proposition. All bases of a vector space [mathjaxinline]V[/mathjaxinline] must have the same number of vectors.

Definition. The dimension of a vector space [mathjaxinline]V[/mathjaxinline] is defined to be the number of vectors in a basis of [mathjaxinline]V[/mathjaxinline]. If [mathjaxinline]V[/mathjaxinline] has no finite basis, we say that [mathjaxinline]V[/mathjaxinline] is infinite-dimensional.
